title: farm
author: Tanner
caption: He was waiting for a bus, in the rain. The street was dark, and lit only by a dim and buzzing lamp overhead. And although no one could see it, his eyes were unfocused, only vaguely directed downwards perhaps due to his sagging head. He’d evidently forgotten his umbrella, and as the rain plummeted on to the unmoving figure, each drop impacted as if to push him out of his trance. But they weren’t enough. Because he was not concerned with the water seeping through his jacket, or his own shivering form hidden beneath. There on that dark and raining street, the person who waited for a bus to come… was afraid. What he was afraid of is hard to say for me, because he said nothing. There was no one to speak to after all. I imagined what the hollow look in his eyes may denote a fear of. A farm. For him. He worried that his life was akin to that of a domesticated animal, and the turning gears for which he had no ability to perceive even while they ground him into a form which he did not belong in, would never cease their turning as he did not understand what they were. He was worried that he would watch himself die, and somehow have to carry on living in that smoldering crater of what was once purpose. The rain pooled in his pockets, running down his sleeves. However, that was not truly what mortified him. A thought that he was too terrified to revisit once its time plaguing his mind had subsided. His ultimate fear- that he would not care. You see, he believed that within him resided a spark. A spark capable of incredible things, that would unleash an unflinching will wielding power equivalent to its indomitability, after igniting his very own soul. The winds blew through his soaked coat, chilling him to his core, while his body redoubled its desperate shivering. What he feared most of all was that his spark would ignite nothing. That his soul was not kindling at all. That his spark would burn forever in his heart, its flames riding up his inner walls only to scorch and torment him. He was afraid that even as he was ground up as he’d seen countless times before, he wouldn’t put up a fight.  The bus was not coming. It was already far too late for that. - Farm, happy halloween

title: MISC
author: Tanner
caption: sometimes you cannot fight and die for nothing. sometimes you have to give form to something that you cant truthfully say has meaning anymore. having already forgotten its purpose, you cannot again lose its motive. rotting away, washing away, the pulsing of the mechanical heart. supposedly incorrigible, yet so thoroughly corrupt that there lacks even a host for the mold to steal. for the tide to sweep away. to be replaced with clockwork pieces. there has always been that consideration hasn't there. that your truest corruption isn't anything tangible at all. that it might, horribly, disgustingly, catastrophically, and wholly be that imagined being, your pure desire. but truth requires audience i think, and what if there is none?  ...oh god... what if there is none...   it is then that you are left with nothing more potent than scribbles on a black canvas with some words below. not meaningful, not even arranged particularly impressively. just hollow nothingness. it is on exceptionally rare occasion... that you cannot let it end there. you can't fight and die for nothing. not again. so you do it the courtesy of giving it a basic form. even if after all the fighting ended it did die, and you along with it. even if when it counted, you couldn't pull through. even if it went hollow a long long time ago. it can't have been for nothing.

title: Demon
author: Logan
caption: "Tao saw the snake in its essence: its black heart, its cunning mind, its contempt for the last remaining humans. Tao approached silently, his hand clutching the locket of his father. And he thought of his father then, thought of the man dead, thought of the futility of death, and he closed his eyes and screamed, bringing the dagger down with such power that it struck a grating chord out into the rain, and it rang all the way back to the mountain's base."

title: Angel
author: Tanner
caption: At first I thought an Angel and a Demon were not so different, two mostly humanoid beings pursuing their own ideals by their own methods. As I combined them in various ways however, it became difficult to reconcile the two concepts. Angels in their rigidity, their order and Demons in their insatiable hunger and infinite selfish desire. What might a being born as both look like? Where would it LIVE? Surely no Demon could ever be welcome into heaven, while the kind soul of an angel has no place in hell. It would be torture I think, to live with the imperfect combination of a Demons heart and an Angels mind.

title: MISC
author: Tanner
caption: I ask you who I am, beneath the mask. You laugh and say "no one". No one... it's true?.. that I am not anyone? My hand is in the air, raised towards you. I am on my knees. I am praying, worshipping. But... in that moment, my hand was descending. It came toward my back. My leg moved, as if to stand. I am reaching towards something. Something I have always felt was there. Covered in vines, leaves, mushrooms, flowers. Untouched for so very long. "I am no one". The words leak out of the mask like blood spilling from a wound. The laughing is cacophonous, it's ringing in my ears, as if it's coming from my own mouth. I was reaching for your glory, was I not? The nobility of it all howls the loudest. "I am nothing". My hand is almost to the blade. Not a tool, a weapon. Not meant to build, meant to take. My heartbeat drums in head, competing with the sickening sound of laughter. How long have I been about to seize the blade for? I am trapped. In an eternal moment of reach. Your perfection is unattainable. And there is nothing on my back. Why then? Why can I feel its weight? I know it's there... I know it...

title: MISC
author: Tanner
caption: When my hand finally grasped the sword, which was never on my back, the laughing stopped abruptly. My heart pulsed quietly and rhythmically. In the silence, nothing became known to me, I had known the weapon was there all along. Tearing the mask from my face did not reveal an identity huddled away underneath. My body tensed and drew the sword as if it were to deliver a swing with the same motion. The plants once entangling the weapon surged forward to mimic my movement. But there was nothing to attack. My moment of determination was slipping into pointlessness. So I focused my eyes on you. You who I worshipped, you who I dreamt of being. "I am my influence" I say to open air. There is no confirmation, no repercussion, no conclusion. Briefly, the thought of cutting you down is considered. But just as surely I know the sword is there, I know it is not meant for that. It is enough that I have claimed identity, and escaped one more endless moment.

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: For as long as anyone can remember, the endless dungeon has existed. No one knows where it resides, but entrances will exist and not exist all the same. In days long past, many would enter and exit, spreading tales of treasure and plentiful bounties. Its sinister intentions were not always know. Now, no one has come out of an entrance in nearly a century. But in recent times, the beckoning doorways have appeared more and more frequently, and disappeared less and less. As if the gaping maw of the beast pushes outward in a slow but deliberate hunger.   You are a magician of the grand academy. A student, your boundless curiosity has driven you to study the arcane ways. And now, it drives you to a door. It opened not too far from your home and hasn't disappeared for days. As if inviting you, its call is tantalizing. One day you stand before it. As the door creaks open, you feel a tremble go down your spine. Suddenly you are absolutely terrified. Petrified with fear, you can hardly put a foot forward... or flee the maddening sight in front of you... Do you go in?

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: Welp, sometimes you gotta put your big girl pants on, gotta get in there eventually. Hopefully the well doesn't lead anywhere too bad. You wonder if maybe you should've taken the stairs. What do you find in the depths?

title: DYOAB
author: Connor
caption: Meanwhile at the bottom of the well, the fight in the ring was about to come to a close, the goblin looming over the other when suddenly “THE PEOPLES ELBOW!”

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: Seriously, what's the deal with this guy? He's looking at you like you just crushed Throckmorton goblin, firstborn son and heir to the throne or something. Yeesh, you weren't expecting to run into so many weirdos in the dungeon. He probably missed the sick elbow you just landed on that chump...

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: Ah well, of course, you came prepared for this. You figure your great mystical abilities and/or your apparently numerous wrestling proficiencies are about to come in handy.

title: DYOA
author: Logan
caption: A king, eh? Well I have a king of my own.

title: DYOAB
author: Derp
caption: You raise your wand and point it at this chump, casting a spell at him. Upon contact, all of the hair on his head disappears.

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: The goblin king flees the kingdom in shame, leaving only his lieutenant. Apparently you are the new king by goblin law. But you know you've already peaked with the grand entrance  you made earlier so you decide to hit the road. The Lieutenant gives you a map to guide your travels

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: It's actually pretty helpful

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: He also gave you the goblin kings greatest treasure. Which was...

title: DYOA
author: Logan
caption: OH BABY! THE Slightly More Convenient Map  ™️

title: DYOAB
author: Connor
caption: oh, it's just a slightly devilish rubber duck?

title: DYOA
author: Mangoes
caption: The dumb looking helmet that gives really good stats What on earth is this man hoarding..?!

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: In any case, it's time to get going now. You don't know why anyone would establish a village in this place, but you're bound to get some answers there.

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: Your journey leads to a small river, not too wide but wide enough that jumping across is not possible. You travel along the river until you come upon a bridge, blocked by a figure. A tarnished suit of armor, well worn and standing tall before the bridge. It does not appear like anyone is inside, but you swear it looks as though the breastplate rise and falls as if it breathes. Stranger more, it seems overgrown with vines and mushrooms that have cracked the armor apart in places. You observe the motionless thing for awhile, but eventually, you must cross the bridge...

title: DYOA
author: Connor
caption: The knights unmoving body makes you uneasy, something about him makes you not want to fight him. You decide to take another approach as you cast a shrinking spell on yourself. “Maybe I can get past without him noticing…”

title: DYOA
author: Logan
caption: No I don't think so. Let's go Bubbles.

title: DYOAB
author: Daniel
caption: Luckily, fire beats grass type.

title: DYOA
author: Derp
caption: fungus amongus

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: As you make your way across the bridge, you see the remnants of the armor laying disheveled upon the ground. It is obvious that there was no one inside. There are scorch marks around its base, and smoke billows out of its every crevice. The green moss and vines which once crept out from beneath are now no more than stains of ash streaking across the silver surface of the armor.  You cross the river and continue on your way. But, with the smoldering guardian fading behind you, you wonder what exactly you destroyed, and why ever would the grass and fungi stand only to guard a lonely bridge.

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: As you continue on towards the village, you encounter a strange man selling a great many things, what do you buy?

title: DYOAB
author: Connor
caption: gun

title: DYOA
author: Logan
caption: This hat will fit Bubbles well

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: He goes on to tell you of a great beast which guards the village you seek. He does not know why it is there, but he has seen villagers come and go freely. The same as he's seen strangers perish before it. He describes it to you. What is the nature of this defender that he describes? The beast is a bit chunky and a little bit funky. It's got some moves, some hooves, and some grooves. It may look tall, but it I bet with a wand like that you could make it fall. I wish you good luck, and remember: Use the duck

title: DYOA
author: Tanner
caption: He goes on to tell you of a great beast which guards the village you seek. He does not know why it is there, but he has seen villagers come and go freely. The same as he's seen strangers perish before it. He describes a gargantuan armored snow hound. Iron clad and presumably so by the villagers repaying protection in gratitude. He has never seen it wounded, and its metal shell suffers not a dent.

title: DYOA
author: Logan
caption: He goes on to tell you of a great beast which guards the village you seek. He does not know why it is there, but he has seen villagers come and go freely. The same as he's seen strangers perish before it. He describes it to you. It's hard to get in and out of this village when its blockin' da highway

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: What the hell is that supposed to mean? Why does this guy only speak in rhymes? You're starting to really get fed up with the amount of total weirdos around here. I mean this guy's a crackpot through and through. A real basket case. If you weren't so nice you'd probably knock his block off and take his stash. Anyway, the village should be right around the corner. You can scout things out when you get there.

title: DYOA
author: Tanner
caption: Well hey, he did sneak up on you. Really caught you with your pants down. Still, that wasn't close. Feels like you didn't even try. Hopefully that lasting brain damage won't impede your quest for knowledge too much. Assuming you're not dead, you're about to wake up to a very bad headache and a very confusing situation. On account of the brain damage that is.

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: Well, that probably hurt. How long have you been out? Feels like its been like exactly 6 calendar days. In any case, seems you made it to the village. And they love you so much they gave you a free torso blanket! ....you know, I don't think they know how blankets work...

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: But damn if that isn't the BIGGEST fellow you've ever seen. That's gotta be the concussion. You think he's talking to you, but that pesky concussion, making it a little hard to understand. If you could think in words that weren't French, you might try to tell him. Looks he's finished his speech, and he's waiting for you to respond. You got a plan? Mmmm, baguette...

title: DYOAB
author: Logan
caption: Man, what did he say? Best to play it safe. "Oh OF COURSE I'll dab you up no problem my boy!"

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: Wow, they really seem to love you! After untying and giving you your weapons back, they're throwing some sort of parade for you! The chieftain HIMSELF is carrying you through town on his massive shoulders. Finally, some friends in this bleak bleak dungeon.

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: Or not... man the nerve of some people, throwing you off of tall cliffs and whatnot. You didn't think it was possible to go even further down this hell hole but, you've been falling awhile now... what's really disappointing is that you have no further understanding of your situation. And also probably that you reached terminal velocity about 2 minutes ago

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: You fall and fall. You don't stop until time ends. You are where everything ends. As you begin to stand up, sand pours out from your robes. The sky is pitch black but  as far as you can see, dunes are lit by a blazing orb propped up by a sunken colossus on the horizon. Giants armaments, scraps from long dead machinery, and the remenants of all which refuses to be swallowed by the earth litter the ground. What is this place?

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: Your ponderings are cut short by a rumbling across the earth. Something big is moving under the sand. Ready your weapons, you imagine whatever is down here doesn't get to pass up any meals...

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: From below bursts a horrific reptilian creature, multilimbed and not completely unsubmerged from the sand. It releases a cry that sounds as much anguished as enraged, and it rears its head, golden jaws agape and gleaming in the burning dunes. You don't know if you have the firepower to take it down...

title: DYOAB
author: Derp
caption: Just as suddenly, something else arises from the sands. It's... a horse? Although for some reason you view it more as a honse. He is currently pointing a gun at you, but it looks like he has something to say.

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: "So... you woke it up. Listen, I'm a nice horse, so I'm gonna bail you out. Hand over the wand and I take you with me, if not, good luck trying to hurt that thing. You certainly aren't the first to try." The honse's words echo in your ears. Looks like you have a choice to make...

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: Hey... this guy is awesome!

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: Well, looks like you outran the monster and the illustration budget. No idea where the honse is taking you though. Maybe its time to start asking some questions? Or, can you see where you're going on the horizon..?

title: DYOAB
author: Logan
caption: "Honse it goes down" "It don't, it don't go down" "It do go down!"

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: As Honse takes the speeder directly off the cliff, he lets go and assumes a sick pose. Even as you plummet to your demise, you have to admit he looks pretty cool. That being said, you are falling into the abyss, and your admiration is cut short by the GRAVITY of the situation.  The gravity... that's not behaving quite right. You aren't falling down. You're falling backwards, back towards the cliff. Pushing past the fear off death, and the handsome Honse, you notice that you've been completely enveloped in a purple haze. It's emanating from a cave in the side of the cliff, and someone there is drawing you in...

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: As you floated towards the cave, the essences of the purple haze seemed to... fight with your robes. At the very edges of your clothing tinges of orange looked to be pushing away the cloud that carried you. It was hot, and each spark hissed as the mist put it out. You sensed an anger, as if the tiny fires were becoming more infuriated by that probing mist every moment.   It was instantaneous, and you only retained any vague idea of what could have happened because of the feeling of the flames, but somehow you were completely engulfed, as if the fire itself was at its wit's end and was lashing out against its environment. The pain was blinding.  It was in a daze that you were dragged up onto a shelf of a bed, haphazardly carved into the cave wall and held up by rusting metal plates. The one who had operated the gravity defying device moved frantically, and retrieved a sort of string, or a necklace, from a nearby pedestal. You could hardly understand what they said but you made out these words: "Complete the talisman...its shape will give you power...."

title: DYOA
author: Connor
caption: You feel an overwhelming amount of power coming from the amulet

title: DYOAB
author: Logan
caption: Understanding flows through you... This isn't a globe with 7 seas... Yarrr! The ocean we be sailing be a banana! Carried by Chimpo, Titan of Chimpanzees, blessed with divine strength! I simply must spread the word! Ye landlubbers must praise Chimpo, or I'll have ye praisin' the plank you walk down!

title: DYOA
author: Derp
caption: The talisman cloaks you in a mysterious veil that wards away any suspicion from weary eyes towards actions you may take in the future.

title: DYOA
author: Tanner
caption: Connor's talisman will align you with power, Logan's and Derp's will align you with Perception. Take this to mean what you will

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: "Perception huh?"

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: "You're lucky it wasn't contest, the horse would've killed you"

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: "They still caught on FIRE."

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: "They probably just got imprinted on. Why would a pillar of destruction be here?"

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: "Besides, they only just barely aligned with perception, they couldn't hurt a fly. I'm sure it released a lot of perceptus energy but our senses aren't delicate enough to get messed with. Nothing around here is..."

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: Great, it's back. Next time try to keep it in your robes. And worse yet, Honse still has your wand. If only you had some other kind of weapon with you...

title: DYOAB
author: Logan
caption: Can't fight on an empty stomach. And besides, if the talisman is so powerful, eating it has gotta do something good for me

title: DYOAB
author: Connor
caption: In a snap, everything went black... Your body goes numb as the flames appear around you. Your senses start to fail as all you can see, hear, think, is of the being right behind you. The Eldritch Muunk'Eye. You already know what he's here for, the medalion has been eaten. He has come to grant you protection.

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: CHIMPO!?!?!?! He's here!!  ...  is that helpful? I mean... he's just a little guy it looks like.

title: DYOAB
author: Tanner
caption: DOMAIN EXPANSION

title: DYOA
author: Tanner
caption: oh... he was just kiddin' around. they're actually chill I guess

title: DYOA
author: Tanner
caption: invenshmory
